snippet: A burst of moviegoing, led by “Gone Girl,” follows a spring-summer season that saw domestic sales drop 15 percent from a year ago.
abstract: David Fincher thriller Gone Girl earns $26.8 million in domestic ticket sales over weekend, pushing box office to estimated $149 million along with strong showings from other films; surge in moviegoing lifts studios' hopes following spring-summer season that saw domestic sales drop 15 percent since 2013.
lead_paragraph: A burst of moviegoing, led by “Gone Girl,” follows a spring-summer season that saw domestic sales drop 15 percent from a year ago.

headline.main: ‘Gone Girl’ Shakes Off Box Office Cobwebs
headline.print_headline: ‘Gone Girl’ Shakes Off Box Office Cobwebs
